intro: Tritoniopsis longituba, commonly known as the long-tube tritoniopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
